writeLabel

public static void writeLabel(Writer out,
                              String label,
                              boolean mandatory,
                              String styleClass,
                              String formElementId,
                              javax.servlet.jsp.PageContext pageContext,
                              boolean showColon,
                              String accessKey,
                              String style)
                       throws Exception
General method to write label.

Parameters:
out - The writer for writing to.
label - The final label to show.
mandatory - Boolean to render label as mandatory (with asterisk) or not.
styleClass - An optional CSS class for <label> (actually span@class attribute).
formElementId - Will be used for composing label ID and for associating label with an input ( label@for attribute).
pageContext - The current page JSP context.
showColon - Boolean that controls whether the label text will have a trailing colon or not.
accessKey - An optional single character that will serve the purpose of shortcut input access key.
style - Optional CSS rules for span@style attribute.
Throws:
Exception - Unexpected exception.

setAccessKeyId

public void setAccessKeyId(String accessKeyId)
Sets the resource ID containing the access key for this label. This attribute is optiona. If it is not specified, the resource ID is constructed as <label-id>.access-key. When this resource exists and contains a single character, this character is used as an access key for the label. Otherwise no access key is used.
